result.execSummary:
The defendant Reginald Bernard Richardson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with case 16CM349.
Review hearing March 17, 2017 at 1:30 p.m.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  Due to DNA & DV surcharges assessed on case 2014CM3530, Court will waive fees for case 2015CM1428.

No contact with firearms.
Court advised the defendant is prohibited from posssession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

No contact with firearms.
No contact with victim Tanya R. until further ordered by this Court.  Court will allow third  party contact for purpose of child(ren) and or grandchild(ren) visitation.

Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
Pay supervision fees.
AODA assessment.  Comply with recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Reginald Bernard Richardson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Request to Issue Civil Judgment for Court Obligations.
no reply from defendant or surety. lj

Defendant Reginald Bernard Richardson in court.  Angela D. Cunningham appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($330.00) gj
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($20.00) gj

Defendant Reginald Bernard Richardson in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Defendant Reginald Bernard Richardson in custody.  Charles Kreger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea/sentencing. Parties have reached an agreement.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. State complied with victim notification. Statements by parties and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1: The court sentenced the defendant to 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to 2016CM349.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 MONTHS, CONCURRENT to case 2016CM349.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 25 DAYS in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
-Obtain/maintain employment if able.
-No contact with firearms.
-No contact with victim Tanya R. until further ordered by this court. Court will allow third party contact for purpose of child(ren) and or grandchild(ren) visitation. 
-Provide DNA Sample.

-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Due to DNA & DV surcharges assessed on case 2014CM3530, Court will waive fees for case 2015CM1428.
-Pay supervision fee.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief

Probation Review Hearing in Branch 36.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for March 17, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Reginald Bernard Richardson in custody not in court. Attorney Robert J Hampton in court.  Angela D. Cunningham appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives defendant's appearance. Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 36.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 2, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY with Breathalyzer Tests. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with Tanya R.

Defendant Reginald Bernard Richardson in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Defendant Reginald Bernard Richardson in custody.  Michelle Ackerman Havas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kremers, Branch 36.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 4, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Plea & Sentencing.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued forthwith. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited, but held pending restitution and recompense.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.
Court ordered $20 forfeited from the $350.00 originally posted.
Enrty of 6/30/2015 entered in error. Court amended cash bail to $20.00 and bail is to be forfeited from $350.00 originally posted.

ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  Present in court is Justice Point/WCS Case Worker Meghan Wautier.  Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant. Court amends cash bail. $25 cash bail forfeited from the $300 originally posted.  Case remains calendared for sentencing on July 28, 2015 in Branch 23

Defendant Reginald Bernard Richardson in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Status Conference with pending matter set for Sentencing. Defense requests matter be set for a Plea & Sentencing date with 14CM3530. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Reginald Bernard Richardson in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Reginald Bernard Richardson in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised due to lower pending case this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Status conference scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
